description: information about plants that are food

command.prompt:
Generate one row for a table of information about plants that are food. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes for the table is:
Plant;Variety;Season;Color;Fruit;Soil;Water;Temperature;Light;Pruning;Fertilizer;Pest

Do not generate fictional rows. Generate the rows from real known data. Here is a list of semi-colon-separated rows not to generate by semantic key only:
Plant;Variety
Apple;Granny Smith
Basil, Sweet;Summer
Broccoli;Spring
Cabbage;Fall
Pear;Bartlett
Cherry;Rainier
Raspberry;Bountiful
Peach;August Pride
Watermelon;Crimson Sweet
Grape;Concord
Strawberry;Temptation
Carrot;Nantes
Radish;Cherry Belle
Eggplant;Neon
Avocado;Hass
Cucumber;Lemon
Squash;Acorn
Asparagus;Jersey Knight
Tomato;Beefsteak
Lettuce;Romaine
Spinach;Space

Output the row in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file with a column header. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.epilogue:
Bluecrop is a variety of blueberry that is known for its firm, light blue fruit. It is a versatile plant that can produce fruit throughout the spring, summer, and fall seasons, making it a great choice for home gardeners who want a long-lasting blueberry crop. Bluecrop blueberries prefer moist, acidic soil and thrive in full sun with moderate pruning. They require regular watering and should be fertilized with an acidic fertilizer to maintain the correct soil pH. The main pest that affects blueberry plants is birds, who can damage the fruit and foliage. To protect blueberry plants from birds, it is recommended to use netting or other bird deterrents.

Source:
https://www.gardeningknowhow.com/edible/fruits/blueberries/bluecrop-blueberry-plants.htm
https://www.burpee.com/vegetables/fruits/highbush-blueberry-plants/prod10001.html
https://www.starkbros.com/growing-guide/plant-care/articles/how-to-grow-blueberries
